review_title: Great first experience for VR beginners
one_reviews_text: If you have a parent, grandparent, or non-gamer that wants to give VR a shot, this is a great way for them to see what its about. There's no movement, no potential for motion sickness, no jumpscares, and it moves at their pace with no stress. It's also just a fun and charming experience. I keep this installed on the off chance that someone new will want to give it a try and I think they'll need a little time to get up to speed.

This is a small game that is good for starting and discover the device.
The robot is also cute.

review_title: Great for new users to test VR
one_reviews_text: A great starter for VR, Newbies can enjoy this short free experience

hes probably played it like 50 times within 1 week.
its also a great first step experience!
A very sweet and simple VR experience. Only takes about 20 minutes, but it's perfect to make your first steps in VR or to present VR to friends. And the robot is the sweetest thing since Wall E ^^

Oculus WORST Customer service ever!!

Game is terrible because my Original Oculus Rift is broken. Cable broke & Oculus support will not replace or even sell me a headset cable. Now I have a $500 paper weight!!!

This was a perfect opening game to try with your headset for the first time.  This was so much fun for myself and the kids.  Makes you think of the possibilities that is VR.  Wish it was a little longer.

Would I recommend it:    Yes
What do I rate it:              5/5
Pros:                               Controls are super easy.
Cons:                               None.
Motion Sickness:            None.

review_title: A very endearing introduction to VR
one_reviews_text: This is my very first VR headset that I purchased, and I did not know what to expect.  This app was a ton of fun, and the immersion that it provided was beyond impressive.  I find myself wishing it was a little more than a tech demo and wanting to go back.  I recommend it to anyone who has an Oculus Headset.
This is such an impressive tech demo because it kind of sums up what VR is all about: Organic, personal interaction with your storytelling medium. It's perfect
i like how there is finger tracking and its fun to mess with very realistic looking things
Its the best way to show your friends what Vr is
I will never forget my first contact with the VR world..... I almost cried. We need more things like that.

review_title: Definitely a excellent way to start out
one_reviews_text: This is very fun and easy VR enviroment to navigate in, I love the 3D sound it's so real and on point, also it's good to use with first time VR users.
This demo was my first glimpse at VR. It blew me away.

review_title: My 1st time in a VR world!
one_reviews_text:
I finally got a VR headset and wasn't sure if VR would be as good as I had hoped, or if it would be a let down, this app was my 1st time entering the VR world and I am still blown away by how the Oculus Rift S actually transported me into a 3D environment and I did not feel at all like I was even wearing a headset playing a game but that it was real. 
I loved the demo and am glad it was my 1st experience! :D

review_title: this is one of the best vr games .
one_reviews_text: i use this game for freands when they first start out.   easy and cool..  wish it was a full game not a demo.    i wish you could use everything.  and walk around the rv.    that rv is sick looking.
But what happened to the robot??? Are they dead? Can i get them back in another game, please?

review_title: Wow! Great way to kick-off 1st exper.
one_reviews_text: This was an amazing demo ... I would love to explore that whole RV.  This blew my socks off, and is great way to understand what INTERACTIVE VR is all about.  I rarely write reviews, but this experience motivated me to share.  I want to live in that RV, and I wish there were more experience like this one.

A great experience also to show others as an introduction to VR.
It got some mini games integrated.

I really love the WALL-E like robot.


(Played with HTC Vive Cosmos on ReVive)

I only just got into VR but of all the experiences I've tried so far, this is the best one. It's a great introduction into the world of VR. While playing with the robot and the toys, I found myself giggling and laughing like a child. Though small and short, it's reactive to your actions, including the cute little bot. The lighting and texturing is simply amazing.
This would have convinced me to buy a Oculus. Well put together, and perfectly showcases what the Touch Controllers can do.
this will always be a go to,it always amazes me and everyone else

1982, in a RV making Robots?
 Sure. 
Why not.
 Epic!

and my dad xD

I love it! <3

Thanks guys!!!

I have owned an oculus rift for about two years now and out of all the games i have played apart from maybe two other titles this still the best experience i have ever had. I Know this is just a demo but why can oculus not release more interactive games like this?
I used this game many times myself and as a demo for my friends and family! Great visuals, awesome idea!
no sound in rift s ???

After starting with the "normal" introduction to Oculus, this app starts automatically if installed (at least it did for me) I thought it was a part of the introduction, and it did GREAT at that! I'd recommend everyone taking their first steps in VR to start out with this app.

when i frist got in the vr world i just wanted to play robo recall but to my suprize this is on of the most best tutorials in games or consal i was so exited when the oculse got set up after i got my new compter i put it on and then everything was magical.
I use it as a first intro to VR since "Welcome to oculus" is no mpore available for latest software versions.
Cool little demo. Perfect for an introduction into VR.

I was so burned out trying to get my Rift working, I didn't even want to play it right away. It was late on a worknight. I was thinking I'd get it set up, go to bed and start fresh after work the next day.

But then, I all of a sudden find myself standing in an RV.  "We are not in Kansas anymore." I said to myself after that I think I was reduced to giggles and the occasional "woah". 

THEN a robot shows up and wants to play with me. I'm talking to him asking his name, trying to pet him. He's a he I guess I decided. I went into like insta-toddler mode. What a unique experience that I will always remember. I only wish I could relive the magic again for the first time. It's fun watching other people go through it at least.

review_title: it is a great littel game that is fun
one_reviews_text: it is great

I don't think this really needs a review as it automatically plays for all new Rift owners, but I feel the need to stress that people showing other people VR for the first time should put them through this experience.  It is an extremely intuitive and well rounded tutorial that hooks people in immediately.  And it is the only stepping stone I would recommend.  A must-have.
This is a perfect introduction to Touch Controllers and Oculus in general. It teaches all the possibilities with the Touch Controllers and is very visually pleasing.

I owned the CV1 Rift since the day it came out, and didn't use it much. Today I installed the Touch controllers. I was taken through the whole Rift setup again, but this time I was taken to a kind of demo in an '80s styled RV, where you could 3D print stuff like guns and rockets. The feeling of having your hands there... Pardon my French, but the whole experience was a-fcking-mazing and I'm feeling the excitement for VR all over again.
go to oculus free games and get free games today. not a scam its real!!!
Doesn't need saying as you have probably done it but wow. Anytime someone wants to try VR i open this up and just watch. All Ive heard from everyone is wow.
This App has a very solid and comfortable VR experience.
First thing I play when I get my rift and amazed, just the simple things, lets you test out the controlers and the capabilites of what can be expected in other games
First thing i did on my rift was run through this experience and it really shows off what Vr really is all about, Great to show new people as an introduction to Vr.
A great introduction to the Oculus Rift!

I'll never forget the first time I set up the Rift because of this.
Perfect introduction I didn't know I needed.

review_title: This is what a demo has to look like!
one_reviews_text: Awesome introduction to VR, for beginners or for friends youre trying to show it. I recommend it to everyone! There are also many props/(eastereggs??? idk) in the new Oculus Home (Core V2) based on this demo.
Very good immersion, well thought and executed, a piece of art.
I really wish they would do more with the robot and item maker in an add on or something. I simply loved this.

review_title: Great for a first VR experience
one_reviews_text: I make everyone wanting to try the Oculus play this before anything else. It teaches you how to really interact with a VR environment, and has amazing visuals to go along with it.
Words don't even begin to descibe how awesome this Intro to VR is . It is the best thing i have experienced in VR hands down

review_title: I have to thank Oculus and the devs <3
one_reviews_text: Wooow this is so great to make vr exclusive games for such a tiny platform , that's cause of these kind of people that VR is not that big as it should be today.. A Vr headset means to be a display that's all. I have an Htc vive and we have to use revive to play that demo which I loved , but for now I wanted to show that to my daughter , guess what oculus did , an update which will stop you from using it from revive , such frustration. You have to pay an oculus or <3<3<3<3 you ! Nice move ! Compared to steam vr which is and still be an OPEN  platform  , something that you don't have a clue about , is how things needs to be. Oculus, I wanted to buy an oculus rift but as I can see , you guys are a bunch of selfish and money grabbing folks , but gosh , people actually don't buy your stuff because of that. But hell , Facebook bought your company so what you do now you'd still remain with no issues I'm a right ? Let's see that in some couple of years.

review_title: Could not make a better starter app
one_reviews_text:
To be honest, I was totally blown away when I did wear my headset and this launched. I had the oculus in its infancy, and used to play some of the early games; but then I got into this very detailed room, with atomsphere and interactable items all over, and just got a feel that maybe we got VR right this time.

The various activities are mundane and really simplistic, but that WOW effect you get once you are in that van, interacting with the friendly robot, with somehting that is more than just point or grab something, is insanely addictive and really well done.

You can see value in VR when you play products like this: great graphic that is not "cartoonish", and at the same time, you can get good details (I think robo recall is the only other product with the same look and feel). You can have simulations of many jobs in this way; or wacky fun stuff that still seems realistic; and this product show that it is possible, when you design a product from the ground up, to be VR based, and not a generic product with VR functionalities slapped on, for the sake of saying "it is a VR game".

Please make more like this, make full games like this
As an introduction to VR, this thing is downright magical. The little waving robot is pretty adorable, and actually interacting with the different objects gives a good feel for what you can do.

review_title: Best app to show friends and family.
one_reviews_text: I showed this to my brother because I was spellbound by it. It's not time consuming, has a nice pace for new Oculus users, beautiful graphics, and is relaxing. Awesome app.
I couldn't agree more with Joschaxda, did'nt see any eastereggs though
As a welcome to the VR world this is by far the best way to do it.
This is an absolutely superb introduction to VR. I and all my friends who have tried it have been blown away.
This is perfect for anyone new to VR for a fun interactive no pressure experience.  I use this for friends and family interested in giving VR a shot.  Hasn't disappointed anyone yet.
This is the program you run for the people who have never experienced VR before. It acclimates them to VR and how to manipulate objects.

very easy task when you first time entering vr room. its awesome, incredible. 
but i think, it still need little develop to make you can do more thing in there (not only insert disk, throw or punch something)

Perfect First experience to VR. Just enough interaction and not to intense to scare the sensitive people. The first time I played it I was laughing how real things seemed because I it was my first time playing Vr.
Completely wonderful and adorable. Perfect little intro to VR. I wish I could visit my little robot buddy again �

review_title: To door to the world of VR
one_reviews_text: This game is the perfect introduction to VR. Graphics are great, environment is well done and interactive, minigames are fun and at no time did I feel like it was getting boring. Actually I played it 3 times in my first 2 days of owning the Rift, that's how good it is. This is the first app I launch when I want to show VR to friends who never had a chance to try it before.
nice nice nice nice nice nice
incredible

Excellent introduction to a VR environment, a MUST have for starters, excellent to introduce friends to their first touch controllers experience.

Possibly one of my favorite games on Rift. Practically no replay value, but it sets a standard for the quality games on Oculus. Very attractive set.
this was outstanding, honestly blew me away

the developers did an awesome job with this. the touch tutorial transitions so well into this app, and it just works so well at getting people comfortable in vr and wanting to delve deeper into virtual space. i was immediately attatched to the adorable robot, and felt a pinge of sadness when we parted ways, i hope we can meet again.

review_title: I LOVE THIS SO FREAKING MUCH
one_reviews_text: This was the best first interaction I had with VR, really really amazing. I felt sad when the robot left and terried when he first came. Wow I loved this.

Awesome graphic quality. (the best vr with best graphics is this one)
Its my first game for VR. Very cool.

review_title: First experience=understood VR was the S
one_reviews_text:
+: First VR experience which made me understand VR was the superior way to implement heartwarming experiences!
+: Felt awesome as a first experience; other games such as “The Lab” (the spaceship defender and the bow in particular) and “Robot Recall” are another examples of good first VR experiences.
+: Good controls, physics and interactivity.
+: Virtual 3D printing :)
=: Long enough to make you want more but still be satisfied.
=: No particular negative aspect to report other than I would have liked to explore the rest of the room after reaching the end of the demo – I wanted more and that’s definitively a good thing!
SPOILER: Look under the table!

Good tutorial game to break users into touch controller. I with it included the very basic hand controls shown during the set up as well, so that I can use this app to bring friends up to speed without giving too many instructions.

this little gem is what appeared out of nowhere after i completed the setup of the touch controllers.  it feels so realistic and we had a lot of fun doing it many times. also, my 6 year old son and his friend had a shot at this and they understood right away how to use the controllers and interact with this virtual world. it was a blast for them.  the only downside is that once you complete it for the first time the app doesn't show up in the library.  you must go in the oculus desktop app and either start it from there or install it.  it will then appear in the library.
Couldn't have asked for a better introduction to VR. Very "Wall-e"ish and great for all people of all ages.
I love showing this to people

It is hands down a must try, an absolutely amazing and immersive experience! 5 minures or so long, it's more of a tech demo, really, but man it feels so real and stunningly captivating. 

P.S.: to whoever developed this: GUYS PLEASE MAKE A FULL GAME OUT OF THIS! Seriously, this could be an amazing modempunk andenture game. Just do this guys, people will literally throw money at you!
Very nice introduction !!!

review_title: Amazing, for starting with VR and more
one_reviews_text: Amazing, even after months of VR, once starting it again, it IS actually fun to do a little bit of things here, like throwing things around, embrassing the environment and the effects, trying things out (I even found something new I didn't tried when I started VR) and also a good one to show others what VR is about. It's exactly what it wants/claims to be and it's doing that very well.

...and it is a top notch experience. Great intro, and still some of the best VR graphics I have seen. I think Oculus thought, "Let's make something that would blow the minds of people new to VR.", yep mission accomplished.
Very good intro to VR and the Oculus Touch.

This has definitely been one of my most memorable gaming experiences. There are very few games that leave me with a genuine smile and sense of wonder, but this game managed to warm my heart like nothing else I've ever played. It's such a brilliant introduction to VR and the Touch controllers and is something I highly recommend everyone try if you somehow haven't yet. It's also a great first VR experience if you're letting someone else try your Rift out.
Could be better and longer. The graphics is excellent.
This was a fantastic introduction to Oculus Touch, and so very charming too!

review_title: Great VR Demo for New People
one_reviews_text: This is a great program for showing off your fancy new VR headset to anyone. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star, however, is that I felt there should be more hidden things that people can discover. I've seen many people try to mess around with different things around the room, but from what I know, there's not much besides button pushing and picking up stuff. Otherwise, this is a great intro to VR.

This game is a very nice presentation of what the VR game can do. Certainly not all capabilities of the VR platform were shown. This is very much standing front facing game. Overall I really liked it.

review_title: Great 80s nostalgia and wall-e type robo
one_reviews_text: Best tutorial for VR you could ask for. I use it frequently to introduce people to Oculus. Never had anyone dissappointed.
A very nice demo about oculus rift+touch :)

So if you're like me, you'll change the setup of your Oculus from standing room 2 sensor setup and then to a 3 sensor full roomscale setup.  Well, everytime you do that and try to properly setup the sensors, this tutorial will play.  Unless you uninstall it.  I really liked the cute tutorial the first time I played it, it wasn't so much fun the 4th or 5th time.  This is a play once and then uninstall.  No replay value.
This is so cool. Its has a retro 1980's tech / Apple feel to it. I loved it!
Great intro to VR!
Just amazing we're already on this high level of technology, awesome first encounter with VR.
best what they do and for free

This experience blew my mind and made me realize VR will change everything. It's got the emotional qualities of a mini-Pixar film coupled with the magic and immersion of a great game. Someone at Facebook should let this team create some full length AAA content for the Oculus Touch! I've been pulling people to my house to demo the Oculus Touch and this is the experience I have them do -- all of them tell me its blown their minds.

A phantastic experience, with brilliant art design. The robot could have had some more reaction patterns though. For example he doesn't react in any way, even if I throw his diskettes at him. All people I put in there tryed to interact with him.

This experience has breathed life into gaming once again!  (Gaming is good, but it's been repetetive lately.... Call of Duty, Uncharted, Call of Duty, Battlefield, Call of .......etc.)  Some of, if not, THE most beautiful graphics I've ever seen in gaming.  It almost got a 4 star because of the hardware (the Oculus).  These VR goggles are low-resolution and medium quality.  It's like they took a step back to DVD quality. But it's understandable as I'm sure it's due to the intense graphics, most PC's wouldn't have been able to handle.  Got my respect!
As the first VR exprience this was simply perfect. Nice graphics, cool things to do. What else can you wish from a free(!) VR exprience...

please expand on this!!!! i love this!!!!
when i described this tutorial to my friend i told him its an 80's sci fi movie mixed with WALL-E

This VR introduction gave me probably the best VR experience =)

review_title: This needs to be a full-length game!
one_reviews_text: This needs to be a full-length game!

A wonderful introduction to the VR world! The depth of the graphics and the physics displayed are great. This is a perfect tutorial for beginners in VR. If possible, I'd like to see more of this type of VR simulations and I would LOVE to be able to build that little robot companion. :)
This was the greatest experience I have had being introduced to a new reality. It was so well done. If you have never used the Oculus Rift, this has to be your first experience!!!

review_title: And with hands comes great interactivity
one_reviews_text:
This is the perfect introduction for the Oculus Touch (or any device like it). 
Suggestion for the devs: MORE BUTTONS!
Try putting your hand in a monitor.
I want to watch the video-tapes! PLEASE!

This is always the first thing I put people in when trying Oculus + Touch for the first time. Oculus made the perfect first party application that really "wows" the audience and gets them believing in the potential of VR from the very first time.

When people want to come over and try VR for the first time, this is what I have them play first. It goes through all the basic things and lets you mess around with a myriad of things. Ive noticed that each person that goes through it does things a tiny bit differently and tries something I didnt even think of my first time through.
Great way to introduce new folks into VR. Even had both my parents start understanding the controllers after they went through this tutorial. Nicely done!

review_title: Oculus knows how to make apps
one_reviews_text:
This has an incredible amount of "being there" and I'd argue it is at the top in that regard of all the touch apps/games I have used. 

I feel Dreamdeck is also great for this and it just seems Oculus really knows what they're doing when it comes to creating that immersion/presence feeling.

review_title: Ok, this was super SUPER cool
one_reviews_text: Just try it. So great. Apart from the main experience, pick up the circuit board. Look at it, turn it, in the light. This is some amazing stuff

Everything jumps up and down. Even 6 weeks after release. It's a nightmare! (yes, I have set up everything correctly and spent a thousand hours fixing USB issues, even though everything is fine with my USB)
its a copy of tron, wallE, number5, job simulator and a few other bits and pieces, but its very fun and trains people how to use the touch controllers pretty well! :)

This is a perfect example on hitting the hammer on the head demographically. I felt like getting out my 300 baud modem and hitting a few BBS stations to look for more VR demos. Rewatch D.A.R.Y.L, E.T, or Gotcha!. Hook up my NES Gyromite for a bit. I enjoyed this so much it touched the inner 12 year old nerd.  I can't give this enough stars. To me this is priceless.

The fact that I'm even bothering to write a review for a tutorial should tell you something.  It's fun, quirky and achives the goal of demonstrating and familiarizing the capabilities of the Touch controller, while also providing a fun interactable environment that encourages exploration.  When people visit to try Rift and Touch, I start them with this.  Very nicely done, Oculus!

Best first way to have fun with Touch!  In addition to shooting the robot, you will shoot yourself, the butterflies, the tin cans and anything else you can get at.  You will try to shoot objects way in the back. You will try to hit the robot with the rockets. You will see if you can shoot off the same rocket twice (you can). You will pick up videotapes and other items and start throwing them. You will see if you can pick up the robot's hands before you turn him on (you can't).  You will try to put the cartridge in the machine when there is already one in there, and realize you keep forgetting to take the old one out before you try to put the new one in.  You will try pressing random buttons around you. You will realize that you can print out more objects if you keep pressing the button next to the printer. You will realize that as you print objects, other previously printed objects in the room disappear.  If you haven't yet tried these things, you will after reading this review! Most of all, you will just have fun with this!

I was surprised at how much fun I had in this demo. Great for learning hand controls and VR dexterity and coordination. Favourite bit was printing out about 16 rockets and stacking them in a pile, making a couple o guns, launching as many rockets as i could at the same time and blasting at them like a maniac with both guns :D joy.
This demo is better than all non-vr games on PC and consoles.

I mean back when VR was first a thing, this is how it felt like it was imagined. Old monitors, computers and storage media. Being able to interact with an 80's style system in new age tech is amazing.

review_title: Best way to demo touch controls.
one_reviews_text: If you want to demo touch controls to first time users, this is without a doubt the best one to start with. Trying this demo for the first time, I had the same smile and look of awe on my face when I first tried the DK1,
GREAT introduction to VR

This is a great demo that really shows off what this platform is capable of. A great setting that just "feels" real with very fun things to play with that one wouldn't otherwise be able to do in the real world. Man, reality is over-rated!

This is an excellent choice to introduce the platform. Everything is kept in the near-to-medium field where stereoscopy is highly effective, the robot is a cool character who doesn't get too annoying and responds to all sorts of interactions, the 3D printer looks amazing when it's working, the various different objects are really fun to play with, and everything is carefully explained. Evidently they play-tested the hell out of it. The only issue I had was not knowing which machine to put each disk in sometimes. Probably not something you'll come back to after trying it for 10 minutes or so, but it really immediately showed the power of the new controllers in an accessible way.
This is an exellent introduction to VR!
This is a very well done demo, awesome way to demo the touch controllers to family and friends.
Perfect introduction to Oculus Touch, high production values and great 80s inspired setting - yes kids, those things are VHS tapes and floppy disks - Google it..... :)

I wish there was a "funny" button for the comments section here because a reviewer below gave it a bad review because he couldn't play it sitting. Really?

Anyways, showed it to my fiance and she loved it. Definitely a great first time intro to VR, very polished and very immersive being able to walk all around, pick up the tapes, play with the toys, and interact with the robot character.

She has not been big into VR but I think this one opened her eyes to the possibilities.
This is a brilliant demo to show family and friends. A great start to the touch controllers :)

I'm really disapointed. Of course it works, look good, sound fun. But i like to play while sat. I'm stuck after a few mn. I can't put the cartdrige in the player because i'm playing in front of my desk and the player is so low and far that my (RL) hand go under the desk and i lose tracking. For a tutorial, a sitting compatible application would have been appreciated.
I like him, he's pretty chill.
Wow it is so cool! Just tested it on 8 people and all of them was so happy. Best for first try to see what this revolution is all about. Perfect experience!

It is fun, it is entertaining, looks good, works perfect not only as a game, but as a social experience too. It is soo natural to communicate with others in this game, when you wanna talk, you talk, when you wanna wave you wave, gestures just come soo easy.
This is pretty much my go-to demo for people new to VR/Touch. Everyone loves it, and I never get tired of demoing it.

review_title: Great but doesnt work with my headphones
one_reviews_text: Great demo but it is hard-coded to use Oculus headphones. I wish it would work with my headphones.
Stunning accomplishment in terms of creating a magical and FRIENDLY environment for people to experience VR for the first time. Perfect execution. Flawless victory.
I felt to be part of an early Steven Spielberg movie. I can see no better way to introduce people to Oculus VR with touch controls!
A fun demo and a great intro into touch!

review_title: I bought the game after playing this
one_reviews_text: great intro to the system!
Showing this along with Bullet Train is a perfect way to introduce folks to the Touch. This is very cute and interactive.
Great first time use for the controllers, had a massive grin on my face using it for the first time. It's free and works incredibly well with the tech.

review_title: This is how you do an Intro!
one_reviews_text: This would be the first thing you with your Oculus Touch but it will be in your mind for a very long time. Impressive intro! Well done guys!
What an awesome first impression. Visually looks great and it felt so right using the touch controllers. Rockets, butterflies, the toys...

I enjoyed it, my kids enjoyed it. It's free. Nuff said.

Thank you, Oculus, for this free app.

review_title: Can't imagine better intro to Touch !
one_reviews_text: Real fun here, with a essential intro to Touch. Easy understanding of the controllers, and so deliciously 80's !
You need to show everybody this app before anything else, so much fun!
I enjoyed this little introduction to the Touch, as did my family members who are new to the tech. It's short, sweet, and free.
Just a perfect introduction to VR + Touch
This will WOW . Very Impressive indeed.
and thx again!
After all the waiting & hype, this experience after the initial setup was just perfect. Thanks Oculus!

i just recently purchased oculus complete set once i set everything up this game or tutorial was the first thing i played. its simple to navigate and the overall experience was amazing, i only wished it was a actual game of some sort. im very inpressed with graphics and interaction it really does transport you to another place... =)
Nice demo to show friends that are interested in VR.  Short and sweet.
Great intro for the touch controllers, makes great use of them, shows off the accuracy as well.
This needs to be a full fledged adventure/puzzle game... make it happen Oculus!
Very nice and funny introduction! Try it!
a great 80s vibe and an innovative tutorial of how wonderful Touch is
Masterfully made.
Great.

review_title: The best demo for new users
one_reviews_text: I have been demoing VR to friends for some time and this is by far the best experience to show new users.  It looks stunning and is very relaxed.  Loads of little games with motion control and gestures.
